text: The Football Association of the Czech Republic (; FAČR) is the governing body of football in the Czech Republic. It is in charge of the men's and the women's national teams. The association was founded in 1901. It became a member of FIFA in 1907 and UEFA in 1954. During the formation of Czechoslovakia, it was known as the Czechoslovak Football Association (; ČSAF) from 1923 to 1993 and was controlled the Czechoslovakia national football team. Category:1901 establishments in Europe Czech Republic Category:Football in the Czech Republic Category:Sports organizations of the Czech Republic
title: Football Association of the Czech Republic
